Since Lt⋆​(⋅)subscriptsuperscript𝐿⋆𝑡⋅L^{\star}_{t}(\cdot) is also H𝐻H-smooth, combing (D) and (30) proves Theorem 3.

Appendix E Proof of Theorem 4

Let l~​(𝜽,𝐱)≜l​(𝜽,(𝐱,𝐲0))−λ​c​((𝐱,𝐲0),(𝐱0,𝐲0))≜~𝑙𝜽𝐱𝑙𝜽𝐱subscript𝐲0𝜆𝑐𝐱subscript𝐲0subscript𝐱0subscript𝐲0\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x})\triangleq l(\boldsymbol{\theta},(\mathbf{x},\mathbf{y}_{0}))-\lambda c((\mathbf{x},\mathbf{y}_{0}),(\mathbf{x}_{0},\mathbf{y}_{0})), then the robust surrogate loss lλ​(𝜽,(𝐱0,𝐲0))=sup𝐱∈𝒳l~​(𝜽,𝐱)subscript𝑙𝜆𝜽subscript𝐱0subscript𝐲0subscriptsupremum𝐱𝒳~𝑙𝜽𝐱l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\theta},(\mathbf{x}_{0},\mathbf{y}_{0}))=\sup_{\mathbf{x}\in\mathcal{X}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}). Based on Assumption 5 and 7, it can be easily shown that l~​(𝜽,𝐱)~𝑙𝜽𝐱\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}) is (λ−H𝐱𝐱)𝜆subscript𝐻𝐱𝐱(\lambda-H_{\mathbf{xx}})-strongly concave with respect to 𝐱𝐱\mathbf{x}. Let 𝐱⋆​(𝜽)=a​r​g​m​a​x𝐱∈𝒳​l~​(𝜽,𝐱)superscript𝐱⋆𝜽𝑎𝑟𝑔𝑚𝑎subscript𝑥𝐱𝒳~𝑙𝜽𝐱\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta})=argmax_{\mathbf{x}\in\mathcal{X}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}). From Lemma 1 in [19], we conclude that lλsubscript𝑙𝜆l_{\lambda} is differentiable and ∇𝜽lλ​(𝜽,(𝐱0,𝐲0))=∇𝜽l~​(𝜽,𝐱⋆​(𝜽))subscript∇𝜽subscript𝑙𝜆𝜽subscript𝐱0subscript𝐲0subscript∇𝜽~𝑙𝜽superscript𝐱⋆𝜽\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\theta},(\mathbf{x}_{0},\mathbf{y}_{0}))=\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta})). Moreover,

‖𝐱⋆​(𝜽)−𝐱⋆​(𝜽′)‖≤H𝐱​𝜽λ−H𝐱𝐱​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖,normsuperscript𝐱⋆𝜽superscript𝐱⋆superscript𝜽′subscript𝐻𝐱𝜽𝜆subscript𝐻𝐱𝐱norm𝜽superscript𝜽′\|\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta})-\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})\|\leq\frac{H_{\mathbf{x}\boldsymbol{\theta}}}{\lambda-H_{\mathbf{xx}}}\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|, (31)

and

‖∇𝜽lλ​(𝜽)−∇𝜽lλ​(𝜽′)‖≤normsubscript∇𝜽subscript𝑙𝜆𝜽subscript∇𝜽subscript𝑙𝜆superscript𝜽′absent\displaystyle\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\theta})-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})\|\leq (H+H𝜽​𝐱​H𝐱​𝜽λ−H𝐱𝐱)​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖𝐻subscript𝐻𝜽𝐱subscript𝐻𝐱𝜽𝜆subscript𝐻𝐱𝐱norm𝜽superscript𝜽′\displaystyle\left(H+\frac{H_{\boldsymbol{\theta}\mathbf{x}}H_{\mathbf{x}\boldsymbol{\theta}}}{\lambda-H_{\mathbf{xx}}}\right)\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|
≜≜\displaystyle\triangleq Hλ​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖.subscript𝐻𝜆norm𝜽superscript𝜽′\displaystyle H_{\lambda}\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|.

Besides,

‖∇𝜽lλ​(𝜽)−∇𝜽lλ​(𝜽′)‖normsubscript∇𝜽subscript𝑙𝜆𝜽subscript∇𝜽subscript𝑙𝜆superscript𝜽′\displaystyle\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\theta})-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})\|
=\displaystyle= ‖∇𝜽l~​(𝜽,𝐱⋆​(𝜽))−∇𝜽l~​(𝜽′,𝐱⋆​(𝜽′))‖normsubscript∇𝜽~𝑙𝜽superscript𝐱⋆𝜽subscript∇𝜽~𝑙superscript𝜽′superscript𝐱⋆superscript𝜽′\displaystyle\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}))-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}))\|
=\displaystyle= ∥∇𝜽l~(𝜽,𝐱⋆(𝜽))−∇𝜽l~(𝜽,𝐱⋆(𝜽′))+∇𝜽l~(𝜽,𝐱⋆(𝜽′))\displaystyle\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}))-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}))+\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}))
−∇𝜽l~(𝜽′,𝐱⋆(𝜽′))∥\displaystyle-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}))\|
≥\displaystyle\geq ‖∇𝜽l~​(𝜽,𝐱⋆​(𝜽′))−∇𝜽l~​(𝜽′,𝐱⋆​(𝜽′))‖normsubscript∇𝜽~𝑙𝜽superscript𝐱⋆superscript𝜽′subscript∇𝜽~𝑙superscript𝜽′superscript𝐱⋆superscript𝜽′\displaystyle\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}))-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}))\|
−‖∇𝜽l~​(𝜽,𝐱⋆​(𝜽))−∇𝜽l~​(𝜽,𝐱⋆​(𝜽′))‖normsubscript∇𝜽~𝑙𝜽superscript𝐱⋆𝜽subscript∇𝜽~𝑙𝜽superscript𝐱⋆superscript𝜽′\displaystyle-\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}))-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\tilde{l}(\boldsymbol{\theta},\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}))\|
≥\displaystyle\geq μ​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖−H𝜽​𝐱​‖𝐱⋆​(𝜽)−𝐱⋆​(𝜽′)‖𝜇norm𝜽superscript𝜽′subscript𝐻𝜽𝐱normsuperscript𝐱⋆𝜽superscript𝐱⋆superscript𝜽′\displaystyle\mu\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|-H_{\boldsymbol{\theta}\mathbf{x}}\|\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta})-\mathbf{x}^{\star}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})\|
≥\displaystyle\geq (μ−H𝜽​𝐱​H𝐱​𝜽λ−H𝐱𝐱)​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖≜μλ​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖.≜𝜇subscript𝐻𝜽𝐱subscript𝐻𝐱𝜽𝜆subscript𝐻𝐱𝐱norm𝜽superscript𝜽′subscript𝜇𝜆norm𝜽superscript𝜽′\displaystyle\left(\mu-\frac{H_{\boldsymbol{\theta}\mathbf{x}}H_{\mathbf{x}\boldsymbol{\theta}}}{\lambda-H_{\mathbf{xx}}}\right)\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|\triangleq\mu_{\lambda}\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|.

So the strongly convexity and smoothness of the robust surrogate loss lλsubscript𝑙𝜆l_{\lambda} still hold if λ𝜆\lambda is large enough. Based on the triangle inequality, 𝔼Pi​[lλ​(𝜽,(𝐱i,𝐲i))]subscript𝔼subscript𝑃𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑙𝜆𝜽subscript𝐱𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖\mathbb{E}_{P_{i}}[l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\theta},(\mathbf{x}_{i},\mathbf{y}_{i}))] is μλsubscript𝜇𝜆\mu_{\lambda}-strongly convex and Hλsubscript𝐻𝜆H_{\lambda}-smooth both with respect to 𝜽𝜽\boldsymbol{\theta} for all i∈𝒮𝑖𝒮i\in\mathcal{S}.

Denote H~i​(𝜽)=𝔼Pi​[lλ​(𝜽,(𝐱i,𝐲i))]subscript~𝐻𝑖𝜽subscript𝔼subscript𝑃𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑙𝜆𝜽subscript𝐱𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})=\mathbb{E}_{P_{i}}[l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\theta},(\mathbf{x}_{i},\mathbf{y}_{i}))]. Then we have

‖∇𝜽𝔼Pi​[lλ​(ϕi​(𝜽),(𝐱i,𝐲i))]−∇𝜽𝔼Pi​[lλ​(ϕi′​(𝜽′),(𝐱i,𝐲i))]‖normsubscript∇𝜽subscript𝔼subscript𝑃𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑙𝜆subscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖𝜽subscript𝐱𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖subscript∇𝜽subscript𝔼subscript𝑃𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑙𝜆superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖′superscript𝜽′subscript𝐱𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖\displaystyle\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathbb{E}_{P_{i}}[l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}),(\mathbf{x}_{i},\mathbf{y}_{i}))]-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathbb{E}_{P_{i}}[l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}),(\mathbf{x}_{i},\mathbf{y}_{i}))]\|
=\displaystyle= ‖∇H~i​(ϕi)​[I−α​∇2Li​(𝜽)]−∇H~i​(ϕi′)​[I−α​∇2Li​(𝜽′)]‖norm∇subscript~𝐻𝑖subscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖delimited-[]𝐼𝛼superscript∇2subscript𝐿𝑖𝜽∇subscript~𝐻𝑖superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖′delimited-[]𝐼𝛼superscript∇2subscript𝐿𝑖superscript𝜽′\displaystyle\|\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i})[I-\alpha\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})]-\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime})[I-\alpha\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})]\|
=\displaystyle= ∥∇H~i(ϕi)[I−α∇2Li(𝜽)]−∇H~i(ϕi′)[I−α∇2Li(𝜽′)]\displaystyle\|\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i})[I-\alpha\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})]-\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime})[I-\alpha\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})]
+α∇H~i(ϕi′)∇2Li(𝜽)−α∇H~i(ϕi′)∇2Li(𝜽)∥\displaystyle+\alpha\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime})\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})-\alpha\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime})\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})\|
=\displaystyle= ∥[∇H~i(ϕi)−∇H~i(ϕi′)][I−α∇2Li(𝜽)]\displaystyle\|[\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i})-\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime})][I-\alpha\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})]
−α∇H~i(ϕi′)[∇2Li(𝜽)−∇2Li(𝜽′)]∥.\displaystyle-\alpha\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime})[\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})-\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})]\|. (32)

Since ∇ϕi=I−α​∇2Li​(𝜽)∇subscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖𝐼𝛼superscript∇2subscript𝐿𝑖𝜽\nabla\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}=I-\alpha\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}), it follows from Assumption 6 and 7 that 1−α​H≤∇ϕi≤1−α​μ1𝛼𝐻∇subscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖1𝛼𝜇1-\alpha H\leq\nabla\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}\leq 1-\alpha\mu, which indicates

(1−α​H)​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖≤‖ϕi−ϕi′‖≤(1−α​μ)​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖.1𝛼𝐻norm𝜽superscript𝜽′normsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖subscriptsuperscriptbold-italic-ϕ′𝑖1𝛼𝜇norm𝜽superscript𝜽′(1-\alpha H)\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|\leq\|\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}-\boldsymbol{\phi}^{\prime}_{i}\|\leq(1-\alpha\mu)\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|.

Continuing with (E), it is clear that

‖∇𝜽𝔼Pi​[lλ​(ϕi​(𝜽),(𝐱i,𝐲i))]−∇𝜽𝔼Pi​[lλ​(ϕi′​(𝜽′),(𝐱i,𝐲i))]‖normsubscript∇𝜽subscript𝔼subscript𝑃𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑙𝜆subscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖𝜽subscript𝐱𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖subscript∇𝜽subscript𝔼subscript𝑃𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑙𝜆superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖′superscript𝜽′subscript𝐱𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖\displaystyle\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathbb{E}_{P_{i}}[l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}),(\mathbf{x}_{i},\mathbf{y}_{i}))]-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathbb{E}_{P_{i}}[l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}),(\mathbf{x}_{i},\mathbf{y}_{i}))]\|
≥\displaystyle\geq (1−α​H)​‖∇H~i​(ϕi)−∇H~i​(ϕi′)‖1𝛼𝐻norm∇subscript~𝐻𝑖subscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖∇subscript~𝐻𝑖superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖′\displaystyle(1-\alpha H)\|\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i})-\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime})\|
−α​B​‖∇2Li​(𝜽)−∇2Li​(𝜽′)‖𝛼𝐵normsuperscript∇2subscript𝐿𝑖𝜽superscript∇2subscript𝐿𝑖superscript𝜽′\displaystyle-\alpha B\|\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})-\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})\|
≥\displaystyle\geq μλ​(1−α​H)​‖ϕi−ϕi′‖−α​B​ρ​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖subscript𝜇𝜆1𝛼𝐻normsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖′𝛼𝐵𝜌norm𝜽superscript𝜽′\displaystyle\mu_{\lambda}(1-\alpha H)\|\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}-\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime}\|-\alpha B\rho\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|
≥\displaystyle\geq [μλ​(1−α​H)2−α​B​ρ]​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖,delimited-[]subscript𝜇𝜆superscript1𝛼𝐻2𝛼𝐵𝜌norm𝜽superscript𝜽′\displaystyle[\mu_{\lambda}(1-\alpha H)^{2}-\alpha B\rho]\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|,

and

‖∇𝜽𝔼Pi​[lλ​(ϕi​(𝜽),(𝐱i,𝐲i))]−∇𝜽𝔼Pi​[lλ​(ϕi′​(𝜽′),(𝐱i,𝐲i))]‖normsubscript∇𝜽subscript𝔼subscript𝑃𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑙𝜆subscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖𝜽subscript𝐱𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖subscript∇𝜽subscript𝔼subscript𝑃𝑖delimited-[]subscript𝑙𝜆superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖′superscript𝜽′subscript𝐱𝑖subscript𝐲𝑖\displaystyle\|\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathbb{E}_{P_{i}}[l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}),(\mathbf{x}_{i},\mathbf{y}_{i}))]-\nabla_{\boldsymbol{\theta}}\mathbb{E}_{P_{i}}[l_{\lambda}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}),(\mathbf{x}_{i},\mathbf{y}_{i}))]\|
≤\displaystyle\leq (1−α​μ)​‖∇H~i​(ϕi)−∇H~i​(ϕi′)‖1𝛼𝜇norm∇subscript~𝐻𝑖subscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖∇subscript~𝐻𝑖superscriptsubscriptbold-italic-ϕ𝑖′\displaystyle(1-\alpha\mu)\|\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i})-\nabla\tilde{H}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\phi}_{i}^{\prime})\|
+α​B​‖∇2Li​(𝜽)−∇2Li​(𝜽′)‖𝛼𝐵normsuperscript∇2subscript𝐿𝑖𝜽superscript∇2subscript𝐿𝑖superscript𝜽′\displaystyle+\alpha B\|\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta})-\nabla^{2}L_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime})\|

≤\displaystyle\leq [Hλ​(1−α​μ)2+α​B​ρ]​‖𝜽−𝜽′‖.delimited-[]subscript𝐻𝜆superscript1𝛼𝜇2𝛼𝐵𝜌norm𝜽superscript𝜽′\displaystyle[H_{\lambda}(1-\alpha\mu)^{2}+\alpha B\rho]\|\boldsymbol{\theta}-\boldsymbol{\theta}^{\prime}\|.

From the definition of G~i​(𝜽)subscript~𝐺𝑖𝜽\tilde{G}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}), we can have that G~i​(𝜽)subscript~𝐺𝑖𝜽\tilde{G}_{i}(\boldsymbol{\theta}) is μRsubscript𝜇𝑅\mu_{R}-strongly convex and HRsubscript𝐻𝑅H_{R}-smooth, where μR=μ+μλ​(1−α​H)2−α​B​ρsubscript𝜇𝑅𝜇subscript𝜇𝜆superscript1𝛼𝐻2𝛼𝐵𝜌\mu_{R}=\mu+\mu_{\lambda}(1-\alpha H)^{2}-\alpha B\rho and HR=H+Hλ​(1−α​μ)2+α​B​ρsubscript𝐻𝑅𝐻subscript𝐻𝜆superscript1𝛼𝜇2𝛼𝐵𝜌H_{R}=H+H_{\lambda}(1-\alpha\mu)^{2}+\alpha B\rho. Based on the triangle inequality, Theorem 4 can be proved.
